Computer screens can not display moving images: they can fake it by showing static images (or frames) in rapid succession. The makers of Reeborg's world have adopted this strategy to make Reeborg move in his world. Let's modify our definition of téléporte by adding this instruction.

What happens if you have Reeborg step through this program? Does Reeborg now appear at its new location after téléporteing? If so, is everything the way you'd expect ... or does something else needs to be added to the above definition for téléporte?

You might want to use voir_source and examine some more and experiment with various changes. Based on the limited amount of information you have, it is likely to be a real puzzle to figure out what to do ... but the best way to learn about programming is trying your hand at those puzzles on your own first, before moving to the next lesson.

We can use the Javascript keyword delete to remove attributes or methods from a corresponding object, either from a specific instance or from all the instances by removing it from the prototype like we have done here.
